availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Stephen F. Gano (Scott County, Kentucky, physician, farmer, KY state rep, lieutenant-colonel and surgeon (U.S.A.))

body.p: Scott County, Kentucky, physician, farmer, politician, and soldier. Georgetown, Kentucky, native. Son of Richard Gano and Elizabeth Ewing Gano. Married to Mary Jane Herndon Gano in 1831. Father of Cornelia Gano Long, Robert Gano, Bettie Gano, and William Gano. Graduate of Transylvania University in Lexington, Kentucky, in 1828. Whig member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from Scott County in 1837. Farmer and manufacturer in Scott County, Kentucky, in 1840. Owned fourteen enslaved persons in Scott County in 1840. Whig member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from Scott County in 1847. Physician in Scott County in 1850. Owned seventeen enslaved persons in Scott County in 1850. Farmer and physician in Scott County in 1860. Owned twenty-one enslaved persons in Scott County in 1860. Served in the 7th District of Kentucky (U.S.A.) as lieutenant colonel and surgeon from 1862 to 1865.
